:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

*Notice for Google Integration users*
*NEW*
Starting March 2024, businesses that don’t integrate with Google Consent Mode V2 could experience measurement loss of tracked data from EEA/EU/UK visitors. To prevent this measurement loss across Google’s suite of advertising and analytics tools, you’ll need to set up a cookie banner in HubSpot using an opt-in policy type that targets EEA/EU/UK countries. Personalized data from EU/EEA/UK visitors will only be shared with Google if those visitors provide explicit consent to tracking. <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/privacy-and-consent/support-google-consent-mode-v2|Learn More>
In Conversations > Templates, how would I allow a user permission to allow them to edit a template they didn't create?  Or does only the Owner have ability to set who can edit?
